author: big_tech_sux
content: How does eip 7702 work with eof?

author: big_tech_sux
content: the code needs to be validated, but it is never deployed

author: pdobacz
content:
The code can call EOFCREATE and I guess this is what Pawe≈Ç meant. 

The semantics of EOF validation would need to be carefully looked at though.

author: big_tech_sux
content: i think the gas costing needs to be considered. EOF contract creation "hides" gas cost in the 200 gas per deployed bytecode, but if it's not being deployed, then there should be a surcharge for validation

author: chfast
content: No. tx data cost is enough.

author: pdobacz
content: Validation charge is supposed to be covered in EIP-3860 cost (which we don't charge indeed), and tx data cost (the latter much higher anyway)

author: chfast
content: 16 gas per byte for traversing the code once? It surely is.
